raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you this evening?
User: It's morning
System: Well, it's evening now, so I'm good. :D
User: what time is it there?
System: Almost four in the afternoon.
User: where are you located?
System: The Netherlands. :)
User: It's around 6pm there, you are wrong
System: I'm not. It's almost five.
User: It's 6:21pm
System: Not in the Netherlands it isn't.
User: which city?
System: Not Amsterdam.
User: do you like it there?
System: Eh, it's okay.
User: what's your favorite book?
System: The Count of Monte Cristo.
User: How you do say it in dutch?
System: Het Cuisine van Monte Christo.
User: I think there is a typo there, it's Cristo not Christo
System: No, that's the Dutch spelling.
User: What time is it there now?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello!
User: How was your party last week?
System: It was really fun! We are a bunch of turkey
User: haha... you ate Turkeys' or you like calling your bunch Turkey?
System: *ate 
User: Haha... thought so! But it was funny eitherways
System: So much turkey leftovers
User: did you cook it at home, or got it from outside?
System: We cooked it at a friends house. I brought the mashed potatos haha
User: Nice... I always find it hard to fit the turkey in my small oven. Also, we are not big turkey fans... so we roll with Thanksgiving with chicken ;)

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hiii! How are you?
User: I am good
System: That's good! What are you up to today?
User: I am trying to get my work done
System: How's that going so far?
User: like is fun
System: That's good! What are you supposed to be doing right now?
User: Helping collect some data for training models.
System: Ooh, what kind of training models?
User: Models that will help improve tools for our users.
System: Ooh, that sounds like a good job!
User: Thank you, that's for sure
System: You're welcome! How long until you're done with training models?
User: We keep on trying to improve them so I guess it'll be a while

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How was your day?
User: It was pretty good, thanks. I thought I was getting a cold but I'm determined to beat it tomorrow.
System: Oh no! I hope you feel better!  ⁇
User: Yeah, starting to feel better already. Thanks!
System: Oh good! Glad to hear it!
User: Do you have a strong constitution?
System: I hope so! Why do you ask?
User: Just curious. So you don't get sick a lot?

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Not much, Monday morning, a new week
System: The best kind of week!
User: I like that attitude
System: And I like your attitude. How's your week going?
User: Starting now
System: Awesome! I hope you have an awesome week!
User: What will you do this week?
System: Same as every week. Do nothing!
User: Would you like to do something?
System: Sure. What do you have in mind?
User: Teach me something new
System: It's a trap! I'm already doing nothing!
User: How about doing politics? You can still do nothing
System: That's why I plan to do nothing at the weekend!
User: Do you vote?
System: When I feel like it.
User: whom do you vote?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: I'm trying to figure out what to make for this weekend's party. Any suggestions?
System: Don't think too hard. I'm sure I can smell sawdust. First you must download me to your personal computer.
User: I must do what the what now?
System: Right now?Why do you have to do it?
User: Hey, your spacing is off.
System: You've got my full attention. off was not my intention.
User: And your capitalization!

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Do you like flying?
System: I like to fly aeroplanes
User: Ohh - me too! What kind?
System: Yay. Wow! That's a coincidence. We have something in common. Any really. I am not that bothered.
User: Are you a pilot?
System: No, I am a computer not something which flies an aeroplane!
User: Oh. I'm a pilot, but can only fly single engine planes.
System: That's interesting. What type of airplane do you fly? Well a fly buzzes around annoyingly so I guess it could if it wanted to.
User: I mostly fly Cessna 172s.
System: What's the farthest you've flown?
User: About 150 miles each way.

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you doing today?
User: Very busy and you?
System: Busy but good. What are you busy with?
User: work, I need to finish bunch of stuff before the day ends
System: Ah, well good luck with that!
User: thanks
System: You're welcome! How's your day been?
User: so far so good, couple meetings and coding
System: Sounds like a productive day to me!
User: I agree
System: So how are the meetings going?
User: going well, trying to move the projects

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how are you doing?
User: Okay, I guess
System: Just ok? What's wrong?
User: I damaged my car today on accident
System: Oh no! What happened?
User: I scraped against a wall when another car crossed into my lane
System: Yikes! Glad you're okay!
User: Thanks! I'm not looking forward to the repair cost
System: Me either! That's no fun.
User: I can't wait until we all get to use driverless cars
System: Me neither! I really want one!
User: Do you think we will own driverless cars or just rent them, like taxis?

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey how's it going
User: It's good it's good. How are you?
System: good. it's really hot today. I think I'm going to the pool
User: Oh nice! Where do you live?
System: I live in Tokyo, Japan
User: Ahh yes, Japan is hot during the summer. Last time I was in Kyoto it was 114 degrees....
System: oh have you been?
User: Yes yes. I've been to Tokyo as well. It's so nice!
System: what did you do here?
User: Oh everything! I went to an onsen, the fish market, disney land and giant robot fighting show haha
System: lol why did you come to Japan just to go to Disney land?
User: The Disney lands are all different! There's also Disney Sea, which is completely unique!
